qas.question: How many free people of color lived in Charleston in 1860?
What percentage of Charleston's population were free people of color?
What percentage of Charleston's black population were free people of color?
In what year was the Brown Fellowship Society created?
In what year did the Brown Fellowship Society end?
How many free people of color lived in Charleston in 1680?
What percentage of Charleston's population were slave people of color?
What percentage of Charleston's black population weren't free people of color?
In what year was the Brown Fellowship Society ended?
In what year did the Brown Fellowship Society start?

context: The city also had a large class of free people of color. By 1860, <a0_0><b5_0>3,785<b5_0/><a0_0/> free people of color were in Charleston, nearly <a2_0><b7_0>18%<b7_0/><a2_0/> of the city's black population, and <a1_0><b6_0>8<b6_0/>%<a1_0/> of the total population. Free people of color were far more likely to be of mixed racial background than slaves. Many were educated, practiced skilled crafts, and some even owned substantial property, including slaves. In <a3_0><b8_0>1790<a3_0/>,<b8_0/> they established the Brown Fellowship Society for mutual aid, initially as a burial society. It continued until <a4_0><b9_0>1945<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
